column4: what utility gives this output on console login? 0 packages can be updated.
update-manager probably, it's some python script it runs from /usr/lib/update-manager I believe, I modified it once
how can I get my application to run next to that output?
it's a file 'apt_check.py', run that like 'python /path/to/apt_check.py --help' to get the options
it's part of update-notifier, by default in startup applications

sorry, I couldn't make myself clear, I'd like to my app to the autorun script that is run everytime a console sheel is opened just like the apt-check.py applicaiton. But I do not know which autostart script file that might be
you mean you want it when you open a terminal? Add the command to ~/.bashrc then
but it should run for any user
you can put unverisal startup scripts in /etc/xdg/autostart
automatically run after login that is, in .desktop format
is apt_check.py run that way too?
you can create a .desktop file that does that, put the command on the Exec= line and use a notification bubble or something: notify-send "Updates" "$(python ../../apt_check.py --human-readable)"
I think /etc/xdg/autostart is only run when a gdm session is open
